intro: Staehelina, commonly known as the white sand lily, is a genus of flowering plants in the family Amaryllidaceae. It is native to South Africa and is characterized by its striking white or pale pink flowers. The plants typically grow in sandy or rocky soils and prefer full sun to partial shade. Staehelina species are herbaceous perennials with strap-like leaves and showy, bell-shaped blooms. They are often cultivated for their ornamental value in gardens and botanical collections.
